google_play_reviews.content: So much worse than the iOS client. Constantly crashes when trying to play videos, has no concept of caching opened files(downloading to system does not count), does not support biometric logins
Great application, but I hope devs will update this app soon so tls1.3 will be supported. Even if it's not launching for me right now after setting TLS 1.3, I will give it 5/5 anyways
Fantastic with desktop, unable to do anything with mobile app. It used to work great for years but for over a year now it is broken and known to be broken with no fixes coming.

Seafile itself is a great delta-sync application. But like other reviewers there's a missed opportunity here. They could do 2-way synchronization of files (like AutoSync, SyncThing, or FolderSync Pro do) but instead they limit the auto-upload feature to 1-way and for photos only. I've ended up using Syncthing in combination with Seafile to sync my android device with my other devices. But feels incomplete to have to use a separate app for what this app should have.
In the last version opening files in other apps is broken. Sad but true.
Very limited functionality. Serves its purpose though. Please keep on improving! Edit: Camera Upload does not work properly
It didn't save my 3 hours of work, not even in the version history. Deleted my review from 5 minutes ago
Excellent software !!!
Picture downloads have stopped working on the latest release. Friends have reported the same issue. The app shows downloaded but can't find it anywhere on our phones. Please fix
Works very well!
No issues
I believe a recent update has made it difficult for other apps (AIMP audio player) to find the files.
Just what I need. Simple and easy to use. No clutter.
Cannot add arbitrary folders. Cannot load folders with too many files. Opening settings crashes the app.
Frequent crashes. No share options in the app. The camera upload is sometimes hit or miss. To be fair, the mobile web UI is fantastic.

The biggest waste of potential in cloud computing. Seafile is fast... That's it. It is the most streamlined, reliable service for the task of downloading and sharing files but it does literally nothing else. You can't even search for files, you can't even sync files automatically unless they're taken by a camera. The most basic functionality of free adware programs here on the play store trumps Seafile at full throttle and at that level I'd just suggest grabbing Syncthing. Disappointing.
Upload not working. First thought about there is something wrong in my own server but it is the client that is broken. iOS version is still fine.

Such I shame I have just found this app and seems very useful and easy to backup photos from phone. Though I have downloaded it just as like everyone else the app no longer works, I can't get it to upload anything from the phone onto server side. Might have to start looking for a new app if doesn't get fixed soon.
Photo and video uploads stopped working, and has been broken for the last few weeks.
Most recent update broke functionality. Unable to open folders with more than a few hundred files, auto uploading of photos and videos isn't working. Effectively the app is now useless.
Please add ability to backup the whole phone.
I migrated to seafile from nextcloud and it's just so much more stable and reliable in both server side and client side.
After so many years, picture automatic back-up is still wonky. Sometimes works, sometimes doesn't, no cause given. Still no TLSv1.3 support.
still has a looooooot of room for improvement. The development is super slow and you get update once every Neptune solar year!
I love this app as it is easy to install for localhost but it is not secured with https. Is it ok?
No Dark Mode, please add.

Confusing User Interface to open or export files. The document provider interface does not support Encyrpted libraries so you can't share from other apps to save in your encrypted library, which defeats the purpose.
Could use a GUI refresh to match the look and navigation paradigms of the latest versions of Android, but works pretty well.
Can no longer sign into self hosted server with self signed certificate. Infinite cert error continue dialog loop. Unchanged server software, running note 10+ on Android 10.
Poor sync and terrible files management.
If I wanted a dumb client I'd use the browser.
Not works with private server, ssl https connection issue.
Great app. Leaves little to be desired, however, it would be very nice if it was possible to auto upload arbitrary folders (ie. Signal backup for or titanium backup).
Last update has changed seafile folder to a folder inside of the android data folder which is messing things up - please fix and restore the cache folder to the seafile folder at the root of storage
Doesn't actually sync files, but camera uploads seem to work now.
Finally a way to host your own dropbox clone, but this is a little bettter. This app allows you to connect to your own private file share server. Love this app and the server that I host myself.
Work grate, thank you
This seafile client misses an important feature: folder synchronization..

It is a nice app. On my smartphone opeartes well and I like it. BUT! It doesn't work on my new Android 8.0 tablet. It cannot create my university single sing-on account. I hope this bug can be fixed in the comming updates.

seafile is the BEST private Dropbox replacement, faster than OwnCloud and NextCloud! old review: server and web and desktop clients are awsome but the android client is broken - EDIT IT WORKS - server configuration is sensitive when your container is behind https nginx proxy! make sure SERVICE_URL and FILE_SERVER_ROOT match scheme+url of front end reverse proxy!!!
Wonderful app! Orders of magnitude faster than Nextcloud. Would be better if there is an camera-upload-while-charging-only option.
Does the job but only barely... Automatically uploading/updating edited documents used to work but that kinda stopped not sure if it's my device or the app.
thanks to developer, it is great

Could be much better. Please developers add the ability to download a picture from Seafile to the Android photo gallery... This is not supported. Please add the possibility to sync properly the camera folder. It's not working. You can do MUCH better than this.
awesome
Camera upload works only very sparingly. App hasn't synced for three weeks on my phone.
Had an issue with the Android app being unable to access an encrypted library that had its own password. I kept getting 'Forbidden'. I upgraded my Seafile server to 6.3.4 and the app works fine now.
Camera Upload broken

One "retry button" on the transfer list menu would be great helpful!! As sync does have a problem sometimes, Clear cache/data could help a while. But with retry button. Everyone will make this easier to use especially when uploaded cancelled/failed by it self.
Works fine in my use
Great cloud storage app. Easy to setup.
Camera Upload toggle won't stay on, reverts to off, camera uploads therefore do not work.
Persistent notification: Seafile is using battery
Crashes now on my htc10. Reinstalled, cannot add my own server, because the app crashes right away (before I can enter anything) . Worked fine so far.

Since the last update, there ist a persistent notification "Seafile is running" even though it's not actively used. Two way folder sync would be awesome. Anyway thanks a lot for this great open source work.
Same problem as the person before, Android 8.1 here. Getting a notification that this app is running and uses power, even if the app idles in background.  Still a good app tho!
The lack of (automatic) two-way sync reduces its usefulness compared to other apps. Annoying that user requests with respect to this has been ignored for years.
软件非常棒。不过有个问题，照片目录里子目录照片不会上传，Google照相机人像模式会创建子目录，一次拍照保存两张相片，seafile不会上传人像模式拍摄的相片。
Love this app I can now back up my photos and personal files to my private server
The app enabled me to backup photo/video from several android devices on my private server. Using it for a year and I can definitely recommend it.
You forget it's there & it's just working. Exactly what I want from my Android Cloud Seafile Client.
Its quite good just upload issue. Please fix that and it would be 100% for me.
Please keep good work and update for better feature and performance

Seafile client used in combination with my personal server - a very good replacement for public clouds like Dropbox ... app is very reliable, barely ever had a crash ... Please consider adding separate choices for picture and video sync - I have picture sync on data plan enabled, but do not want to sync videos unless I'm in WLAN ... currently, I have to enable video uploads manually ... forgetting to disable after the upload could burn through the data volume quickly ...
Cant see long filenames

Mega fast loads fast app also uploads fast once you go seafile you never go 
back... I used own cloud & next cloud the site and app where slow & the app 
ducked to many upload issues but seafile no issues

Excellent alternative to Dropbox and Owncloud. Naturally, you have to use 
this app in conjunction with the SeaFile Server, that can be installed on 
your own server. If needed, file encryption at rest is an option, both on 
client and server. 5 stars.
安卓版不错。Windows 10版不能用。

Image view animation is very annoying. Darkening and brightening together 
with size going big and small puts a lot of strain when you are scrolling 
through a lot of images.
It doesn't sync on android? O.o Also crashes when trying to upload MP4 videos from the camera folder. Oneplus 3, android 8.
Love the app and love the platform. Auto-Sync for camera roll works very well and server side can handle my file amount very easily.
Is it possible to synchronize starred file automatically? Feature request: show status of camera auto-upload.

I downgraded my rating by one star since this app crashes as soon as I click on any file on Android 7.1.1 using external SD memory. I can only browse folders and libraries. It's not possible to down/upload any file. I can't reset the preferences to use internal memory because the app crashes every time I try to change this setting. I've deleted the app, all its data and caches but nothing helps. I hope there will be a fix or workaround soon. I'm still using a self-hosted Seafile server with my desktop computers which is working quite well.
Mysteriously cured it's self. All good now
...camera upload is broken.
It is nice and easy to use app. It is sad that there is no option to sync folders to a encrypted library. It would so nice to have this problem fixed.
Why would any sync app not include folder sync!?

The app is useless without any folder syncing capability. You can browse your remote files fine, and download individual files, but lacking the feature to synchronise entire folders between your device and seafile server. Desktop app can do this, yet the devs seem reluctant to implement such basic functionality in the mobile app. It makes zero sense. Two stars only because it "works" otherwise.
Amazing app
小米安卓系统升级到安卓7以后不同步不了联系人了，希望能更新一下下 总之很好的app
Crashes evertime I try to open a video. File downloads and then the app crashes consistently when the video starts to play. Not wasting more time on this half-closed source project.

I have my own seafile server. the android app makes it incredibly easy to sunc files between my laptop and my phone. the app itself is easy to use amd intuitive andbhas not let me down in any way. definitely recommend.

The only self hosted service currently not trying to be many things at once. It is a cloud service and its almost excellent at it. Yeah it's doesn't have the add-ons and looks of next cloud or Pydio but they're are painfully slow, most of their android clients didn't work and I have had enough of apps trying to be many things and end up failing at their major functions. Keep working on fine tuning this.
It crashed when trying to view any file. Running Android 7.1.1
Fantastic way to sync files
It's working but it's not possible to sync automatically documents or what ever you want. Only pictures and videos. New update: sync the contacts doesn't work on Android 7/note 4 resurrection remix.

Works well. Sadly there's no two way sync. I experience heavy battery draining since I'm running Android 7.1.1. It sometimes showes up to 15% usage in the Android Battery stats. I haven't had this on Android 6.x

Fault in the app uses crazy amounts of data trying to upload files. When I download a file to my phone (Nexus 6p), the app keeps trying to re-upload that file back to the server. It fails, and then tries again. This happens over and over until I delete the file from my phone. I had to disable background data over cellular connections for this app to not use up expensive cellular data. Over wifi, I've had it use 30+ GB trying to upload a 5MB file all day. Thank God it didn't do this on a cellular connection.  Other than that, it works great.

Dont worry about the bad reviews, they're mostly from people trying to do what Google Photos already does.  Anyway... I recently switched from Dropbox to a private NextCloud server which was painfully slow so I set up a Seafile server instead and it's far faster and has much better file history!  Sure, Seafile isnt as pretty as Dropbox or NextCloud but it works much, much better.
Well, I can browse my files. Upload files? No. Backup photos? No.

Works well, but it's only a netdrive client rather than a sync tool. Files have to be added/downloaded manually, no auto-sync function. Downloaded files are just "cache", meaning you have to save it elsewhere or they'll be removed when you clear cache (in settings).

Cannot limit down/upload, cannot prevent it from trying (and failing to) upload two huge files at once, cannot sync local folders(!!!!), fails to upload large files if the Internet is too slow (even if it does upload, it cancels after a few minutes and retries forever, killing the connection for others), and the photo uploader sometimes uploads duplicates. That said it works and doesn't crash often, really digging the camera upload feature, and browsing through your uploaded photos in the app works well.
Love the app, recent versions crash when attempting camera folder upload. Checked the git repo and it appears this has been fixed. Any ETA on when a new version will be deployed on google play?
For Seafile.
Make photo backups clear. They happen in the background but without any notification so I have no idea what us going on. A photo backups status would be nice.

I'm using seafile on a private server and it was working wonderfully. But from last few days the android client is not able to list my files. It connects to server and show the libraries but when you open the libraries they are shown empty. I'm currently using samsung note 4, please solve this problem. Thanks

That makes this app very limited in functionality. Please make this a priority function to add. I have been following this application for awhile and on a github thread you stated in version 1.5/1.6 we would get entire folder syncing on the Android client.
